content:
That is what Excel puts on the clipboard for HTML, not some fault in Thunderbird

I just copies three cells somewhat like yours and Excel placed the information on the clipboard in 29 different data formats.

As you can hopefully see from the image, the HTML format does not contain any form of colour description from excel. The styles are there, but they are not invoked in the HTML code.

The image formats used generally appear to have the image correctly coloured, but the Rich Text Format which I would have expected Excel to get right as it was the native format of the Wordpad windows application colours the text but not the background.

content: You old mail where or how? if you have an mbox file from a previous Thunderbird installation with email in it, the best approach is probably use the import export tools add-on to import the email. https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/?src=ss

creator: whillans

content:
In Mail app - You need to export those emails as eg: individual EML files or export the entire folder as mbox text file. Both of those formats can be imported into Thunderbird.

But you do not mention what OS you ae using 'Mail' app can be seen in Windows and in MAC

Windows OS

  1. Create a folder on desktop to hold the .eml files.
  2. Open the Mail application on your Windows 10 computer.
  3. Select the email that you want to save, click the (three dots) Image icon.
  4. Click Save As and select the folder location on where you want to save the file, and then click the Save button.

If using a MAC: Info at this link to export as mbox files. https://support.apple.com/en-gb/guide/mail/mlhlp1030/mac

content:
Per i contatti, basta aprire la scheda della rubrica e trascinarli dalla rubrica A alla rubrica B. Se tieni premuto il tasto Ctrl sulla tastiera, puoi anche selezionare più contatti per volta con il mouse.

Per i file popstate.dat, il problema non sono i file ma le ragioni per cui vengono creati. In molti casi è l'effetto di un software di pulizia del sistema che -non avendo niente di meglio da fare- va a cancellare file all'interno del profilo di Thunderbird. Se usi di questi software assicurati che non tocchino le cartelle di Thunderbird.
creator: @next

Spero di non disturbarti ulteriormente e ti ringrazio ancora. A.

content:
Purtroppo non è chiaro, nella documentazione di CCleaner, quali file rientrino nelle diverse categorie. Il mio suggerimento è di deselezionare tutto.

Se vuoi fare manutenzione di Thunderbird puoi usare i suoi strumenti interni:

  • Compattazione delle cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  • Cache -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/impostazioni-thunderbird-pannello-avanzate#w_spazio-su-disco

Aggiungo per completezza: esistono anche altre cause che portano alla creazione di file popstate.dat. Quella che ho indicato è una delle più frequenti.

content:
THanks for the detailed description. Despite your AV exception, let's please try

  • Start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode
  • Still In Windows safe mode, start Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

Open the Tools > Activity Manager and Error Console (ctrl+shift+J) on a separate monitor so you can see what has most recently occurred when Thunderbird hangs (or in an area of the screen that is not hidden on single monitor)

If the problem does not go away, screen shot the results.

content:
Thank you David,

That solved my problem.

During installation I got so happy when, after having entered my name, email and password, Thunderbird automatically found my email provider and all the data about my account. But ... helas ... I did not notice that it had not understood my account is POP.

The upshot: I had to reinstall the "old" way with all the data to fill in.

I use the wonderful program Thunderbid since almost two decades and still dread to move from one PC to a new one.

ChG
creator: Gustaf17A

content: If you use Windows, and leave the profile in default location, moving to new PCs is easy. Here is the guaranteed set of steps: - exit TB on old PC - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external device - install TB on new PC with a version similar to the version on old PC and exit Thunderbird - copy the Thunderbird folder from external device to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming on new PC to overwrite the default Thunderbird profile. - restart TB and everything will be there.
creator: davidsk

content:
David, Your answer is quite clear and logic. Despite that, it does not work.

I conclude it does not work, because when I have performed your procedure and started TB on the "new PC", then the normal installation dialogues begin; with what's your name, email, pw etc.

I attach here the file profiles.ini as it is in the "old PC" and in the "new PC" since they differ. Note that the "new PC" is a very old laptop where, certainly, Thunderbird once was installed. But it was certainly uninstalled here.

Indeed, this puzzles me a lot. Hopefully you have time for any more hint.

Christer

old PC Profiles.ini ------------------ [General] StartWithLastProfile=1 [Profile0] Name=Gustaf IsRelative=0 Path=E:\proj\Thunderbird\profile

'new PC Profiles.ini ------------------ [InstallD78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=Profiles/4qqnwcq4.default-release Locked=1 [Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/fnydxtq4.default Default=1 [Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/4qqnwcq4.default-release [General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2
creator: Gustaf17A

content: The problem is because the profile on old pc was not on the default C drive. The c drive's Thunderbird folder does not have the profile, and Thunderbird, on being started, looked to drive E for the profile. Since it wasn't there, it started from scratch. To fix this easily, copy the thunderbird as before, with TB not running, and have drive E:\proj\Thunderbird\profile accessible.
creator: davidsk

content:
David,

Thnx. It seems you are getting close.

So, on the new PC you suggest to create E:\proj\Thunderbird\profile. There is but one difficulty: the "new PC" has only one drive, its C:-drive.

Is there any way to modify the contents from E:ROAMING/Thunderbird so that it looks like coming from the standard C-drive roaming/thunderbird? If so, then it wold work, wouldn't it?

Ch
creator: Gustaf17A

content: Okay, this is a little 'dirty', but works: Copy contents of the profile at e:\proj\thunderbird\profile on old PC and paste into the contents of c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\Profiles/4qqnwcq4.default-release Do this when TB is NOT running. That should set all okay.
creator: davidsk

content:
David,

Your last suggestion solved everything: TB has been moved from an "OLD" to a "NEW" pc. It took me some reinstallations due to errors on my side.

I found out that TB does not remove the Thunderbird information in the %appdata% when unistalled.

When I prepared this answer I rediscovered the -P command-line parameter of Thunderbird. If you use it then you can make a batch-file that is "determinate", that is you do not have to copy the 8-bit stochastic part of the profile's path into the batch file. The batch-file I used before this is shown in my pdf-notes found at

https://sky.telia.no/s/0200af87e15ebf54d0a87d3299c0b10fe7d

Again, thank you David for your kind support. To move Thunderbird with profile and mail-messages at other catalogues than default is now easy for me.

Regards, ChG
creator: Gustaf17A

content:
This article provides the basics: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages

You will find that Thunderbird does not have 'white lists' or 'black lists' to permanently identify spam, but relies instead on continual learning. That is, you need to periodically mark good messages as well as spam messages.

If there are some spam messages that always come from an undesired email address, you can create a filter to force such messages to spam - or simply delete.

OK, what I finally figured out is that the profiles migrated to the /snap directory, which is where both the .mozilla (firefox) and .thunderbird folders live. Thanks!!!

content:
If the authentication is OAuth2, you shouldn't see the 'normal password' authentication request for a password - you should see a browser-like window. That works for @aol.com accounts, but for Verizon accounts hosted on AOL, the outgoing server is supposed to be smtp.verizon.net, not smtp.aol.com.

https://help.aol.com/articles/how-do-i-set-up-other-email-applications-to-send-and-receive-my-verizon-net-mail?guccounter=1

In that case, OAuth2 should work for the incoming imap.aol.com, but for the outgoing smtp.verizon.net, use an app password with 'normal password' authentication.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1364324

content:
The Sent folder need not be added: it should be subscribed by right-clicking the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe...

Each account should be set to send on an smtp with a matching User Name (email address), even when the other settings are the same. See this topic for an explanation.

The smtp.verizon.net server should work with normal password and an app password. The smtp.aol.com server works with OAuth2, but it might also work with normal password/app password. My question was whether a @verizon.net account can send through smtp.aol.com with OAuth2.

I think to avoid confusion you should do tests with a single account at a time in a test profile. Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, to create a new profile. Your current profile is unaffected.
creator: sfhowes

content: I can see a way to attach an open pdf to a message, but it's not much better than returning to the original message: copy the url of the pdf tab, imap://.... application/pdf, by selecting it then Ctrl+C, then start a new message and click the Attach button drop-down, Web Page..., paste the url with Ctrl+V. The pdf will show 0 bytes, but the entire file is sent as an attachment, although without the .pdf extension or the original name. Clumsy, but possible.

content:
re :I found the setting for Global Search and turned it on.

Just in case anyone else sees this question and wants to know how you did it....

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom section called 'Indexing'
  • select checkbox 'Enable Global Search and Indexer'

Suggest a restart of Thunderbird to make sure this preference has been correctly saved.

To check a folder is selected for Global Search:

  • Right click on folder and select 'Properties'
  • On 'General Information' tab
  • select checkbox 'Include messages in this folder in Global Search results'

Usually, by default, all folders except Trash and Junk/Spam are auto selected.

Help Articles on how to use the 'Global Search' and repair global database file:

  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/global-search
  • https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Settings/General/Language & Appearance, Advanced..., set the fonts and sizes (in pixels) with Fonts for: Latin, and repeat with Fonts for: Other Writing Systems. Uncheck 'Allow messages to use other fonts'.

content:
The Advanced window controls the display fonts for received and composed messages. To start, keep the fonts at their defaults and adjust the sizes, e.g. 18 or 24, until the body content looks correct.

This article is somewhat obsolete but contains detailed explanations:

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Font_settings_in_Thunderbird

content:
The server names that work best in TB are imap.gmail.com (port 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address) and smtp.gmail.com (port 465, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address). Gmail automatically copies sent messages to the Sent Mail folder, so 'Place a copy in' in Account Settings, Copies & Folders, should be unchecked, and Sent Mail should be subscribed.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Gmail

content: Signatures are defined for each account, so if you create an html signature for account A, save it as sigA.html, make changes for account B, save as sigB.html, ... repeat for other accounts. (The file can a .txt file if it is just plain text.) Set the signature for each account in Account Settings. If you have multiple signatures for each account, they can be managed with add-ons like Quicktext or Signature Switch.

I'll explain further what I hope to do. As you know, in Account Settings and just below the 'Signature Text:' box, there is the setting: 'Attach the signature from a file instead (text, HTML, or image):' One could reference the same file from multiple accounts. Since you can use HTML in the Signature file, is there some HTML code that could retrieve the Thunderbird's account email address or other Thunderbird info?

You need a html file for each account because you do not want to use the same sig file as it does not contain the necessary email address in the signature. In Folder Pane, Select the account name which is using correct signature - click on Write It has a signature displayed. Edit the signature so it has Account 2 email address and save as html file eg: sig2 Then in Account 2 attach that sig2 html file. REpeat for other accounts.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Click to 'account settings' pane, highlight the accounts to move and drag up or down as desired.
creator: davidsk

content:
David - Thank you for this very easy solution. I spent one day trying to correct this arrangement and was not successful. If you have time I have one more issue. Before I had to do a complete reinstall of Windows 11 the inbox of my local folder and gmail folder showed the same messages. Now I get messages in the gmail inbox but not the local folder inbox. Is there a solution for this and if not how do messages get into the local inbox folder.

I am a very long time user of Mozilla products and absolutely love them but I am not as sharp at troubleshooting as I used to be. Thank you very much for helping me with my issue, now I am going to make another $ donation to Mozilla.
creator: cohall46

content: I was glad to assist - and thank you for donating - but, I am unclear on this local folder issue and why the mail should appear in both places. Please provide more info. Thanks.
creator: davidsk

content:
re :Thank you very much for helping me with my issue, now I am going to make another $ donation to Mozilla.

Please note that donating to 'Thunderbird' is not the same as Mozilla.

In Thunderbird 'Help' > 'Make a donation' should take you to the correct location.

Or use this link and click on the 'donation' button located top right. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

Many thanks for your support.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
A couple of years ago I began getting my email messages in my Local folders inbox as well as the the gmail folders inbox - both the local folders and gmail folders are the only folder sets in the left pane. After my Windows 11 update my gmail folder set works as it did before (inbox, spam, sent, etc.) but now nothing shows up in my local folders set like (inbox, spam, sent, etc.)

In my local folders I have an additional 15 folders which contain miscellaneous email that I have saved over the years and continue to hold mail that I want to save. (See the image I included)

Are my local folders not supposed to have links to inbox, spam, sent, etc.? Now these icons do nothing when I click them. If these icons are supposed to be a working part of Thunderbird how do I make them work?

I know that there are a lot of other Thunderbird users who have problems that are much more important it just seems like all of the settings that I have enjoyed for many years have decided to rise up against me. LOL I really appreciate your help.
creator: cohall46

content: All I can state is that I have never seen an account's inbox show in both locations. The normal process is to receive messages in just the one inbox, as you are now experiencing. Others here may have better information on that.
creator: davidsk

content: Maybe I will remove the unresponsive icons in my local local folders and see if anything happens. Thank you for your thoughts, I made a $106 contribution to Thunderbird.
creator: cohall46

content: Thank you very much. Your contribution is appreciated.
creator: davidsk

content: hii, Delete your Unnecessary Emails- Start by going through your email inbox and deleting any emails that you no longer need or that are no longer relevant. This includes old emails, spam, newsletters, and promotional emails. [[Mic Test|https://webcammictest.io/mic-test.io/mic-test]]
creator: sundersen49

content: Assuming you have set Thunderbird as default and not working as intended, this is a Windows function. Start the 'default apps' app in Windows and check the assigned defaults there.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you David! I went into the windows default setting and Thunderbird was the default. I rebooted and chose it again and it now works. Thank you!!
creator: email4eric

content: You're very welcome. I'm glad all is working.
creator: davidsk
